byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from London, and Alison Smale from Vienna. Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura and Palko Karasz from London.
byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ALISON SMALE

abstract: Staggering death toll among refugees and migrants trying to reach Europe underscores dysfunction of European Union, and its inability to develop a unified plan to stop the crisis; roughly 2,500 refugees have died in 2015, not including those feared to have perished recently when smugglers' boats capsized off Libya.
lead_paragraph: The escalating death toll has highlighted the bloc’s failure to quit squabbling and come up with a unified plan for a crisis months in the making.

headline.main: Europe’s Halting Response to Migrant Crisis Draws Criticism as Toll Mounts
headline.print_headline: Deaths Expose Lack of E.U. Plan in Refugee Crisis

snippet: The escalating death toll has highlighted the bloc’s failure to quit squabbling and come up with a unified plan for a crisis months in the making.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
